content: repeat until 2sts before the end of the round k2 6sts decreased 60 sts in total medium size only *k7 k2tog * repeat until end of the round 8sts decreased 64 sts in total large size only *k6 k2tog* repeat until 6 sts from the end of the round and k4 8sts decreased 68sts total toe with the sts placed equally on needles 1 and 2 move the bor stitch marker to the middle at the bottom of your foot needle 1 holds the stitches at the top of your foot needle 2 holds the stitches at the bottom of your foot set up row knit with mc round to the bor stitch marker round 1 decrease round needle 2 knit until 3 sts remain k2tog k1 needle 1 k1 ssk knit until 3 sts remain k2tog k1 needle 2 k1 ssk knit to the bor stitch marker round 2 knit all stitches repeat rounds 1 and 2 until there are 20sts remaining on both needles 40sts in total now continue just knitting round 1 decreasing every round until there are 10sts remaining on both needles 20sts total remove bor stitch marker then knit 5 stitches to the side of the sock kitchener stitch the remaining sts together weave in all ends knit your second sock hand wash gently in cool water dry flat and enjoy helpful tutorials for kitchener stitch i recommend the video how to kitchener toe without ears on youtube by suzanne bryan - https //m youtube com/watch v=efhxnvfmobe for short row heel i recommend `how to knit a short row heel for a sock` by arne & carlos on youtube https //youtu be/lxvxsmp58_o 5 pattern copyright charlotte stone stoneknits 2019 for personal use only colourwork chart please if you would like to share your work and finished socks using the tags #playsocks or #stoneknits on instagram or on ravelry i love seeing your creations snail yarn mini skein sock sets can be purchased at www snailyarn com 6 pattern copyright charlotte stone stoneknits 2019 for personal use only
